job_description:
Stanfields Ltd.

Truro, NS

Job Summary:

Stanfield’s is an iconic Canadian lifestyle and workwear brand. Since 1856, we’ve remained committed to comfort through quality creating innovative underwear, base layers and knitwear staples. As the Senior Product Developer, you will be the lead on all processes of product development for domestic and import partners manufacturing Stanfield’s brands. We are looking for a highly organized individual with thorough knowledge in the processes of garment construction, grading, assessing size specifications and manufacturing timelines. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams including design and manufacturing to ensure quality and design remain true to Stanfield’s legacy.

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of a Canadian, vertical manufacturing team as we continue to lead, learn and evolve the Stanfield’s brand.

Responsibilities:

Lead the PD team to execute product development according to seasonal guidelines
Work collaboratively with the Design/Merchandising team to execute premium product representative of Stanfield’s brands
Create detailed garment technical specification packs by outlining construction processes, providing component requirements, packaging details, and measurements
Measure, inspect and report on all prototype, pre-production & top samples for all import and co-manufacturer builds
Track, manage and review samples throughout development process from inception to production and proactively address any issues or delays that arise
Actively solicits input and works closely with domestic Sewing Machine Operators
Participate in model fitting sessions; provide instruction to vendors for action to achieve proper fits
Leads build for the Bill of Materials and master file style setup
Collaborate closely with the pattern drafting department on maintaining new and active style updates
Develop and maintain good vendor relationships through consistent communication
Responsible for internal testing, follow-up and approval process pertaining to all garments and fabrics
Maintain style spreadsheet and sample shipment logs
Follows standard operating procedures on all requests to meet or exceed quality standards
Completes and maintains all documentation required in the Product Development Process
Provides operations with pertinent details on construction, offering value add recommendations on pattern engineering
Attend and participate in Line Review meetings

Qualifications:

5+ years industry experience preferably within a manufacturing setting
BA Degree/Diploma in Fashion Design, Clothing and Textiles, or a related field
Skilled in all aspects of garment measuring, construction (prefer with costing and marker making experience, but not required), sewing techniques
Understands the product development lifecycle, including cross-functional team requirements
Experience in CAD sketching and design
Advanced knowledge of material use, drape and garment function
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to relay clear and constructive feedback
Strong attention to detail – proven quality workmanship
Proven ability to identify issues, solve problems and work independently or with a team
Proficiency in Excel and Adobe Illustrator
Demonstrates organizational, interpersonal, and time management skills
Ability to work within a fast-paced environment, adhere to tight timelines and prioritize conflicting demands

What We Offer:

Inclusive culture
Vacation allotment and Holiday Schedule
Employee discounts
Defined Contribution Pension Plan
Drug Plan, Health Spending account and Employee Family Assistance Program

Working Conditions:

Potential travel to Montreal/Toronto 2-3 times/ year to visit co-manufacturers
Little to no exposure to disagreeable elements. Office and Plant environments
Almost all activities are of low to medium physical intensity
Moderate mental intensity with periods of higher mental efforts
